properties.areaDesc: Antrim, MI; Leelanau, MI; Presque Isle, MI; Benzie, MI; Cheboygan, MI; Grand Traverse, MI; Chippewa, MI; Charlevoix, MI; Emmet, MI; Mackinac, MI
properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 7 at 9:43AM EST until January 7 at 11:15AM EST by NWS Gaylord MI
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Gaylord has issued a

* Snow Squall Warning for...
Leelanau County in northern Michigan...
Southeastern Chippewa County in eastern Michigan...
Northeastern Benzie County in northern Michigan...
Cheboygan County in northern Michigan...
Northern Grand Traverse County in northern Michigan...
Northwestern Presque Isle County in northern Michigan...
Antrim County in northern Michigan...
Emmet County in northern Michigan...
Charlevoix County in northern Michigan...
Eastern Mackinac County in eastern Michigan...

* Until 1115 AM EST.

* At 943 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line
extending from near Rudyard to 10 miles northwest of Frankfort,
moving east at 40 mph.

HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow.
Wind gusts up to 30 mph.

SOURCE...Radar and webcams.

IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.

US-31 and US-131 may be impacted in northwest lower. I-75 may be
impacted in Cheboygan and Mackinac Counties along with US-2 in
Eastern Upper east of the Mackinac Bridge

This snow squall will be near...
Empire and Pickford around 1000 AM EST.
Sleeping Bear Point, Kelden, Platte Township, Glen Haven and
Stalwart around 1005 AM EST.
Glen Arbor, Munuscong and Burdickville around 1010 AM EST.
Maple City around 1015 AM EST.
Cedar around 1020 AM EST.
Fouch around 1025 AM EST.
Bingham and Greilickville around 1030 AM EST.
Mapleton around 1040 AM EST.

Other locations impacted by this snow squall include Good Harbor,
Raber, Marquette Island, Lake Bellaire and Riggsville.
properties.instruction:
Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes
your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra
time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead
to accidents.

Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the
visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.

CMAMtext: Snow Squall Warning til 11:15 AM EST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy roads. Slow down! -NWS
